description.narrative: To increase utilization of quality, cost-effective nutrition services for pregnant and lactating women, adolescent girls and children under five years of age in select areas of the Recipient's territory.

condition.narrative: The Recipient shall and shall cause the Participating States to:(a) implement the Project in accordance with the institutional,safeguards, financial management and procurement arrangements set out in this Schedule 2 to this Agreement;(b) throughout theperiod of implementation of the Project as necessary, carry out assessment to determine whether the DLIs/DLRs have been met asdetailed in the PIM; and (c) furnish an assessment report together with all necessary supporting documents to the Association forits review.Recurrent
The Recipient shall through the FMOH cause the Participating States to carry out the Project activities in their respective statesin accordance with the Health Care Waste Management Plan.Recurrent

To facilitate the carrying out of Part 1 of the Project, the Recipient, through FMOF, shall make a portion of the proceeds of theFinancing available to each Participating State under a Subsidiary Agreement entered into between the Recipient and theParticipating State, under terms and conditions acceptable to the Association.Recurrent

title.narrative: Children 12-59 months of adolescent mothers (15-19 years of age) dewormed twice a year
Children 6-59 months of adolescent girls (aged 15-19 years) who receive zinc and ORS and treatment for diarrhea
States with complaint redressal mechanism which responds to at least 85% of the complaints
Males aged 15 and older, who can correctly identify key SBCC messages on nutrition and ANH
Signed NGO contracts for service delivery properly managed as per agreed timeline
People, age 15 and older, who can correctly identify key SBCC messages on nutrition and ANH
Females age 15 and older, who can correctly identify key SBCC messages on nutrition and ANH
Children 6-24 months of adolescent girls who receive micronutrient powders as part of complementary feeding
States with nutrition intervention mapping system developed and updated at least annually
Number of women and children who have received basic nutrition services
People who have received essential health, nutrition, and population (HNP) services
Children 6-59 months who receive zinc and ORS as treatment for diarrhea
Children 12-59 months dewormed twice a year
Children 6-24 months who receive micronutrient powders as part of complementary feeding
Pregnant women (15-19 years) who receive intermittent presumptive treatment for malaria [at least 3 doses]
Pregnant women (15-19 years) who received a minimum of 90 iron-folic acid tablets
Pregnant women who received a minimum of 90 iron-folic acid tablets
Direct caretakers of children 6-23 months with acceptable knowledge related to appropriate infant and young child feeding practices
Pregnant women who receive intermittent presumptive treatment for malaria (at least 3 doses)
